data.title: Add Angle and Shadow support to Missile projectiles
data.body:
Missiles can now be launched at an angle and follow targets in a big, lazy curve. 

Additionally, Shadow (code identical to Bullet) was added since missiles can now spend most of their flight above altitude 0 even when attacking ground units.

Solves #3680.

data.title: Mayor issue with attacking buildings
data.body:
There is a issue with how units target buildings or other large actors
Example if there is a building that is 6x6 in size. And a unit is standing in Lower-Right corner. That unit might not be able to attack the building even if he is standing next to it.
Because he must attack the Upper-Left corner of the building.
He cannot simply attack any square that the building occupies.
This makes close combat stuff impossible to do at the moment. If I make a unit with range of 1. He will not be able to attack anything except for silos and other 1x1 buildings.
This also effects RA and CNC gameplay. Because units attacking from the north can stand further away from the target then units from the south.
= Advatange for north players

data.title: Attacking units do not update path if target location changed
data.body: It would be great if something like #4437 could be done for units attacking other units as well. According to my tests, if two units are ordered to attack each other from a distance way out side their weapon range, they'll either move past each other while shooting until they reach their targets' original position and only then repath, or they'll move nose to nose blocking each other's path (which isn't a great behavior either, a unit shouldn't simply stop moving because its path has been blocked by another unit when there's enough free space around it).

data.title: Added contrail effects to sniper shots
data.body: stole the idea from @Angusm3 and his cnc mod http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=16376

data.title: Forbid deep black via "~/.openra/settings.yml" editing on client side
data.body:
It is forbidden to pick deep black color via "color picker", but permitted to get deep black color via "~/.openra/settings.yml" editing. Looks like a bug and should be fixed, IMHO.

In #4425 it was decided, that deep black should be forbidden. So I think it should also be forbidden via "~/.openra/settings.yml" editing.

data.title: Color picker area is not filled with colors.
data.body:
When I start openra instance and trying to pick the color, I see next window:

![Colorpicker_bug0](http://ut.mephi.ru/imgs/other/openra-colorpicker-bug0.png)

Bug is constantly repeated on my system. How can I help with debugging?

Related: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3169

data.title: Update structures.yaml
data.body:
Remove bib from all buildings that do not require one. Lets try it out for a playtest or two.

Hopefully I got the latest code this time?

data.title: Set up all MISS sprites
data.body: also fixed that strange hack to make them invulnerable.

data.title: Optional content installer
data.body: So the main logic is working it will install movies and scores mix files from everything but the the Red Alert Expansions. Some improvements can still be made just wanted to discuss the direction of this idea and how it should be fully implemented.

data.title: LUA feature requests
data.body:
Here is a few stuff I am missing atm:
- Possibility to listen to when a player types a message.
  ex:
  Player.onMessage(function(player, message)
  --code
  end)
- Possibility to listen to if a player clicks with the mouse on the screen.
  ex:
  Player.onMouseClick(function(player, button, wpos)
  --code
  end)
- Possibility to listen to when a player presses a key.
  ex:
  Player.onKeyPress(function(player, key)
  --code
  end)
- Possibility to listen to when a/any actor enters a region.
  ex:
  Region.onAnyActorEnters(region, function(actor)
  --code, region = a square 
  end)
  Region.onActorEnters(actor, region, function()
  --code, region = a square
  end)
- Possibility to listen to when a actor comes in range of another actor.
  ex:
  Actor.onAnyActorInRange(range, function(actor)
  --code, range = the diameter
  end)
  Actor.onActorInRange(actor, range, function(actor)
  --code, range = the diameter
  end)
- Possibility to listen to when a actor kills another actor.
  ex:
  Actor.onKillsAnyActor(actor, function(actor)
  --code
  end)
  Actor.onKillsSpecificActor(actor1, actor2, function()
  --actor1 = attacker, actor2 = who dies
  end)
- Possibility to listen to when a actor hurts a specific or any actor.
- Possibility to listen to when a actor is hurt.
- Make camera / screen fade in / out with different colors.
- To print proper text on screen not "Debug: ...", I want colors support. Like First part of the message should be in certain color and the rest in another.
- Better sound support. Ex:
  Local sound = Sound.Load("mySound")
  sound.pitch(0.3)
  sound.volume(0.8)
  sound.play()
  sound.pause()
  sound.stop()
- Lock / unlock the camera for certain player.
- To close / open / lock also to make it invisible / visible build menu for certain player.
- To access combat class so we can damage units easily.
- Create / destory / listen to widgets.

data.title: Update structures.yaml
data.body:
Touched up descriptions with help from Phrohdoh and Maunz.
Removed bib from Construction Yard and Helipad.

Construction Yard bib was exploitable, when you surround your CY with walls you can still para-drop or chronoshift units onto the bib inside of the walls.

Helipad doesn't need a bib and it should have a smaller footprint then an airfield.

Most other buildings don't need the bib either as its a carry-over from the C&C95 days when buildings had no space in between them(to prevent boxing yourself in) and it looks terrable IMO, but I digress.

data.title: Permit black color
data.body:
Seems to be right way to permit black color.

Related to: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4425

data.title: Detect Xinerama
data.body:
On the first running, OpenRA is maximizing to pseudo full-screen. But it doesn't check Xorg server for Xinerama, so the screen stretches through 3 monitors on my system, that is really inconvenient.

IMHO, OpenRA should be able to detect Xinerama and maximize only through 1 monitor.

> Desktop resolution: 5280x1080
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1374365-detect-xinerama?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Shadow of paradroping infantry shows idle animation.
data.body: Look closely at the shadow of an infantry while its still parachuting down and it will show idle animations.

data.body:
Using mix files taken straight from original game CDs the music player simply just skips to another track when trying to play Act on Instinct (Voiced).

data.title: Interactive installer
data.body:
Just an idea for fun and nostalgia. it really wouldn't serve any purpose other than making the 2 minute install time feel awesome!

In case some people don't know what im talking about i mean the original installer for ra which was a fullscreen thing. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DISkNm4Mfd0

Could be something to think about for the 20th anniversary of ra :P

data.title: Replay viewer: Hotkeys
data.body: We need to see hotkeys assigned to players perspectives in the replay viewer. Say players are assigned to numbers and the worldview to say 'W'. Given num.keys are only 0-9 there would have to be assigned other keys where games involves players more than 10.

data.title: minimap by Utility for minigames is served like black square
data.body: It's not like that in-game map browser and should be something like green?

data.title: LaserZap improvements
data.body: Adds descriptions and HitAnimPalette trait for custom per-weapon HitAnim palettes.

data.title: map-downloading: use filename served by content-disposition as saving location
data.body: fixes #4405;

data.title: Divided system.yaml of all shipping mods into multiple yamls
data.body:
As discussed in #4420.

I kept the 'system' at the beginning of the new files to make clear this is the previous system.yaml stuff and to group them together inside the rules folder.

Merged RA music yamls while I was at it, as there is little reason for 3 files in this case.

data.title: Added nod03b
data.body:
Pretty much the same as nod03a just a different map and some slightly better scripting of the time based gdi attack waves (which now follow the waypoints as they did in the original).

Differences:
2 cell triggers not implemented yet
AI doesn't build its own attack waves like the original
starting units reduced slightly
removed an oil derrick as it was uncapturable
